meanings.definition: Institute legal proceedings against (a person or organization)
meanings.sent1: The lawyer prosecutes the criminal in court.
meanings.sent2: The district attorney prosecutes cases of theft and fraud.
meanings.sent3: The judge chuckled as the cat 'prosecuted' the mouse for stealing its toy.
meanings.sent4: The sun prosecutes the darkness, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: The prosecutor's voice boomed in the courtroom as he passionately prosecuted the defendant.

meanings.definition: Continue with (a course of action) with a view to its completion
meanings.sent1: She prosecutes her studies diligently to achieve good grades.
meanings.sent2: The team prosecutes their plan to build a new playground for the children.
meanings.sent3: The ant 'prosecuted' its journey to the picnic, carrying a heavy crumb.
meanings.sent4: Time prosecutes its march forward, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The artist prosecutes his painting, adding intricate details to make it perfect.
